N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 29.2 - Sale and delivery

State Regulations
(a) A
permit shall authorize only the sale and service of those alcoholic beverages
which the permittee is authorized to sell under his on-premises
license. (b) A permit shall be
effective for a period not to exceed 24 consecutive hours commencing 8 a.m. of
the day for which such permit is issued provided no sale or service of
alcoholic beverages is made contrary to subdivision 5 of section
106
of the Alcoholic Beverage Control Law or
of any rule further restricting the hours of sale promulgated by the local ABC
board of the county in which such function, occasion or event will be
held. (c) Licensed manufacturers
and wholesalers may deliver alcoholic beverages, for the account of the
permittee, to the premises at which the function, occasion or event will be
held. Notes
